elements.title: Glyn Johns (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Glyn Johns (pictured) was the recording engineer for Led Zeppelin's debut album, the Beatles' Get Back Sessions, and the Rolling Stones album Let It Bleed?

elements.title: caused sixteen skydivers to drown (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an air traffic controller's confusion of two planes' locations caused sixteen skydivers to drown after they unknowingly jumped over Lake Erie?

elements.title: David B. McCall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that just four days before his death in 2004, David B. McCall received a presidential pardon from George W. Bush for fraud charges dating from the 1990s?

elements.title: blocked a recent attempt to import more (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that although more than a thousand used Japanese train cars had previously been imported into Indonesia, the Indonesian government blocked a recent attempt to import more?

elements.title: Patricia Banks-Edmiston (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Patricia Banks-Edmiston was prevented from becoming a flight attendant during the 1950s because she was black?

elements.title: 1935 SMU vs. TCU football game (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1935 SMU vs. TCU football game, known as the "Game of the Century", was the first football game in Texas to be broadcast nationally?

elements.title: Emmanuel Zheng Manuo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Emmanuel Zheng Manuo was the first Chinese student in Europe and the first Chinese Jesuit priest?

elements.title: Froge.tour (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Piri & Tommy's Froge.tour included pole dancing?
